data.title: cashVest® by three+one®
data.meta_description: Our Team three+one® is comprised of leaders in banking and public service committed to maximizing taxpayer funds for public entities, K-12 districts & higher-ed institutions. Mike Abbott, MSBA RELATIONSHIP ANALYST mja@threeplusone.us Ext. 718 About Mike Michael Ablowich Vice President maa@threeplusone.us Ext. 720 About Michael Scott Allen, MBA CFO sja@threeplusone.us Ext. 702 About Scott Michael Burroughs […]
data.text:
Mike graduated from St. John Fisher University in 2021, with a B.S. in Corporate Finance and a minor in Data Science. While there, he was a member of Delta Sigma Pi, the Gamma Class Professional Events Chair, served on the Finance Committee, and worked actively with the Office of Multicultural Affairs. He is currently pursuing a Masters in Business Analytics from St. Bonaventure University.

Mike originally joined three+one as a Data Analyst and has since transitioned into a client-facing role. He works closely with banking and investment partners on behalf of the entities he serves to ensure they are getting the most out of their liquidity and treasury services data.

Mike has developed specialized analytical tools for Suffolk County, NY and a watershed protection public benefit corporation in New York that have allowed them to look deeper into their data and optimize the value of their cash. In addition, he has written and coordinated RFPs for three+one clients for banking and financial services for higher education and municipal customers. He works closely with a range of higher education clients as well as large counties in New York, California, Montana, North Carolina, and Washington.

In his free time, Mike coaches a soccer team for elementary schoolers. He also runs a youth soccer clinic for 9- to 14-year-olds. He enjoys staying fit and is currently training to run a half marathon. As he begins his professional life, he looks forward to spending his free time traveling; on the top of his “go-to” list are Jamaica and Italy.

Mike has worked in public financial management for nearly 30 years, as a state treasurer, state budget director, and technical advisor to several national treasuries in developing and transition countries.

Mike leads our relationship-management team and is also responsible for new client onboarding and their success at three+one. Additionally, he serves a number of cashVest® clients including Westchester and Orange Counties in New York; Washington County, Tennessee; and the Suffolk County Water Authority in New York.

As state treasurer, and in prior leadership roles in the New Hampshire State Treasury, Mike led a variety of projects to integrate different banking products and reporting services into the daily operations of the treasury. Additionally, he developed and managed RFPs for financial advisory, banking and trustee, and paying-agent services for the State of New Hampshire. For the past 15 years, he has worked abroad with a variety of countries on strengthening public financial management, transparency, and treasury operations through the U.S. Treasury Department’s Office of Technical Assistance.

Mike earned his Master’s Degree in Business Administration from the University of New Hampshire and a Bachelor’s Degree in International Relations from Boston University. In 2005, he earned the “Tanya Gritz Award for Excellence” in Debt Management by the State Debt Management Network and, in the following year, he earned the “Jesse Unruh Award.” This latter accolade, awarded by the National Association of State Treasurers, recognizes the outstanding service of a state treasurer who is currently holding office.

A military veteran, Mike is proud to have served his country as an Army infantry officer.

Scott has been a key member of the three+one team and its development since 2016. He is a very experienced professional with over 30 years in business and finance. Prior to joining three+one, Scott most recently served as Vice President and Business Finance Manager with J.P. Morgan’s Private Bank covering teams in various parts of the Northeastern United States. Throughout his career, he has held a number of diverse leadership roles, of which many were with J.P.Morgan Chase in the greater Rochester, NY area. These have included financial planning, branch and district management, operations and compliance, as well as financial management and strategic planning.

In addition to numerous financial licenses and designations, Scott earned both his BS degree magna cum laude and MBA degree with high distinction from St. John Fisher University.

On the personal side, he most enjoys spending quality time with his wife and their three children, as well as sports and travel.

Michael W. Burroughs joins three+one as its National Sales Manager. His primary responsibility will be managing the firm’s business development activities, with a focus on new revenue opportunities and enhancing long-term strategic client relationships.

Prior to joining our team, Michael has had numerous leadership positions over his long career in banking and finance. These include National Sales Manager for Public Sector and Higher Ed, Chief Operating Officer, and Manager of Sales Strategy and Administration. His teams were responsible for driving new revenue opportunities, leading strategic planning initiatives, improving sales reporting and analytics, coordinating training, overseeing sales-incentive programs, and risk-infrastructure buildout.

Michael brings more than three decades of banking experience to his current position with three+one, including 30+ years at PNC Bank where he held several leadership positions, spanning retail banking, business banking, and treasury management. In addition, Michael spent four years at TriState Capital Bank where he was responsible for the initial buildout of the bank’s treasury-management platform.

Michael graduated from Washington & Jefferson College with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Business Administration.

Bill’s career in public service spans 37 years, and includes serving as an elected official at the village, town and county levels of local government. He served as Schoharie County’s Chief Financial Officer and elected County Treasurer for 24 years, and will be retiring at the end of 2019. Bill also served for many years as the Budget Officer for Schoharie County.

In the aftermath of Hurricane Irene in 2011, Bill served for 8 years as the Flood Recovery Coordinator for Schoharie County. He was responsible for overseeing the reconstruction of county government buildings encompassing $100 million worth of infrastructure projects and coordinating FEMA reimbursements.

Bill is a past-President of the New York State Association of Counties (NYSAC) and served on NYSAC’s Board of Directors for 12 years. He was also Chairman of the NYSAC Investment Committee. Additionally, he is a past-President of the New York State County Treasurers and Finance Officers Association, and was the recipient of the ‘County Treasurer of the Year Award’ in 2013, and the ‘President’s Award’ in 2016.

Bill served as a Member of the Board of Directors of the National Association of Counties (NACo), is Member of the National Association of County Treasurers and Finance Officers (NACTFO), also a member of the Government Finance Officers Association (GFOA), and past-President of the Board of Governors of the New York State Municipal Insurance Reciprocal (NYMIR) with more than $150 million in assets.

Bill is a graduate of the State University of New York, with a Bachelor’s of Science degree in Public Administration, with a concentration in Public Finance and Economics.

He and his wife Sherry have five grown children and eight grandchildren, and they live in Glenville, NY.

Kyle Cline serves as National Director of Strategic Partnerships at the National Association of Counties’ Financial Services Corporation (FSC). In this role, he works to develop and deliver value-added, public-private solutions on behalf of the nation’s 3,069 counties.

Among those efforts, he supports the cashvest® liquidity analysis program by managing key relationships with numerous state association sponsors of the program, driving business development and affiliate marketing activities, and ensuring NACo.’s members have access to the revenue generating opportunities that the program provides.

Before joining NACo, Kyle served as National Policy Advisor and head of federal government relations for the Indiana Farm Bureau in Indianapolis. Prior to that, he was awarded the Robert Bosch Foundation Fellowship in Germany and served as General Manager of the Richard G. Lugar Center for Renewable Energy at Indiana University Purdue University-Indianapolis (IUPUI).

Kyle holds a bachelor’s degree in Political Science and a master’s degree in Public Affairs (MPA), both from Indiana University.

Lauren Cybul graduated from the Rochester Institute of Technology in 2021 with a double major in Business Administration and Hospitality & Tourism, and minored in Advertising & Public Relations. She graduated summa cum laude and was recognized for her academic accomplishments and community service. Lauren was a member of both Beta Gamma Sigma and Eta Sigma Delta, and received the Outstanding Graduate Award, an honor only bestowed to the top one percent of all undergraduate students.

While an RIT student, she helped run the Hospitality Financial and Technology Professionals Club (HFTP) and the American Hotel and Lodging Association, while also participating in Project SpiRIT and Women in Business.

Lauren became interested in fintech after volunteering at the Hospitality Industry Technology Exposition and Conference (HITEC), the world’s largest and oldest hospitality technology event.

In her free time, Lauren enjoys cooking, playing cards and board games, and traveling. She also enjoys challenging herself by trying new things outside of her comfort zone!

Alex first joined three+one as an analyst intern in 2015 and has since grown into a leadership role on our Relationship Team, He now serves as a subject matter expert on our cashVest analysis. His work at three+one allows him to dig into the analytics of public finance and banking while working closely with CFOs, Controllers, elected Treasurers, and more.

Alex regularly collaborates with banking and investment partners on behalf of the entities he serves in order to confirm that these entities are utilizing their liquidity and treasury services to the fullest potential. He has worked directly with municipal boards and councils to aid in the implementation of new investment and collateral policies. His passion of increasing transparency in the public finance space fits perfectly with three+one’s mission of sharing actionable data and certifying that public entities are doing everything they can to maximize the value of their taxpayer dollars.

Alex has worked with various entities with multi-billion dollar budgets across the country to streamline and enhance liquidity-management processes, returning millions of dollars to taxpayers and stakeholders. He has worked in conjunction with one of the largest counties in the nation to develop and administer an RFP for Banking Services, Merchant Services, and ePayable Products. Alex is also a regular presenter for the National Association of Counties and various state associations across the U.S. Among others, he serves Harris County, TX; Suffolk County, NY; and the City of Syracuse, NY.

In May 2020, Anthony DiLeo graduated from St. John Fisher University. In his four years there, he studied Finance and Accounting and was involved in several organizations. In the business school, Anthony held leadership positions in Omega Psi, Fisher’s chapter of Delta Sigma Pi, a well-respected business fraternity, and in the Investment Club. In addition, he was president of Beta Gamma Sigma, an international business honor society that only extends invitations to the top 10% of the class.

While at college, Anthony had two different internships in corporate tax. Starting in his freshman year, he worked at Tops Markets, responsible for Sales and Use tax reporting. He continued this job throughout his college years.

After finishing his junior year, he accepted an internship with Carestream Health in its Tax and Internal Audit department. Over several months there, Anthony had the opportunity to travel to Shanghai, China, to assist in an internal audit. Spending time in one of the world’s most fascinating cities is an experience he will never forget.

His internships gave Anthony valuable exposure to the corporate income tax world and ultimately led to a full-time tax analyst position upon graduation. In this analyst role, he worked in tax reporting, compliance, and transfer pricing.

When he’s not busy at work, Anthony enjoys traveling, playing golf, and spending quality time with his family and friends.

Sidney, who hails from Rochester, NY, completed his undergraduate degree at the University of Rochester, earning his Bachelor of Science degree in Biomolecular Engineering in 2018. Before joining three+one, he spent five years in the healthcare industry, working on clinical trials in neurology. Sidney assisted in trials involving pharmaceuticals and medical devices, focused on capturing target-related endpoints. He ensured that outcomes were measured and evaluated in compliance with all relevant regulatory standards.

During his work on clinical trials, Sidney sought to further his expertise in business strategy and management. With that in mind, he pursued and earned an MBA at the University of Rochester’s William E. Simon School of Business.

It was Sidney’s entrepreneurial spirit and unwavering commitment to customer service that led him to his role at three+one. Joining our team as a Relationship Specialist, Sidney embodies three+one’s mission of passionately optimizing fiscal performance and guiding our clients’ strategic decision-making through data analysis.

Outside of his work at three+one, Sidney finds joy in coaching and playing soccer, fishing, hiking, and walking with his two dogs. A true travel aficionado, Sidney dreams of future trips to Greece, Italy, Spain, Belgium, and Germany with his family and friends. He also enjoys collaborating with his family on a number of real-estate projects.

Peter’s entire career has been dedicated to the municipal and not-for-profit sectors. His passion for servicing these entities is evidenced by his earning a Masters Degree in Public Administration from Syracuse University. He started his career as a program analyst for the Oneida Indian Nation and placed his feet firmly on the path of finding efficiencies to benefit organizations that serve the public. Peter later joined Rulison and Company as the first employee of the new Muniflow service – a service designed to assist municipalities invest their funds without endangering daily cash requirements. The service was eventually sold to Bank of America where Peter continued his career through June of 2014.

Peter gained vast experience through his various roles in different divisions within the Bank. Each position required customized approaches, identifying client needs and providing the right treasury services to meet those needs. In 2006, Peter earned his Certified Treasury Professional (CTP) designation and maintains that designation to this day.

Peter’s commitment to the public and not-for-profit community is also exhibited in his volunteer activities. Most recently Peter has been elected as President of the Fairport Central School District Board of Education. He has previously served on the Seneca Waterways Council of the Boy Scouts of America and the Roundtree Homeowners Association.

After graduating magna cum laude from St. Lawrence University, with a double major in Economics and Business, Tyler joined three+one® as an intern and is now a Relationship Specialist. He serves public and Higher Ed finance officials across New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Kentucky, Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, Nebraska, Texas, and California, helping them generate non-tax revenue by maximizing their financial assets.

Tyler’s work with Cabarrus County, NC; Westmoreland County, PA; and the City of Columbia, SC, is returning tens of millions in new savings and revenue annually to their taxpayers. Tyler is a frequent speaker at conferences by the GFOA and three+one’s state association partners on the topics of cash and liquidity management.

Tyler collaborates with towns, cities, school districts, and counties to uncover the potential of their cash through three+one’s proprietary data analyses and cashVest® portal technology. Tyler specializes in the planning and execution of requests for proposal for banking and investment management services through three+one’s rfpPrep® platform. A recent banking services RFP he conducted for a city with a $112 million budget resulted in over $345,000 in new revenue and savings annually for the municipality.

Outside of the office, Tyler enjoys physical fitness, the outdoors, snowboarding, and car detailing. Tyler’s passion for entrepreneurship and technology led to the creation of his company, iClariti, which he founded while in high school. As an avid traveler, Tyler’s most memorable trips were to Austria, New Zealand, and China. In 2018, he competed in the second annual Xi’an Kunming Lake Rowing Regat

David Hastings is a proud graduate of SUNY Oswego, where he earned his B.S. degree in Business Administration, with a focus in Entrepreneurship. Upon graduation, David gained valuable work experience through different positions at Belhurst Castle and Fidelis Care. While working at Fidelis Care, he assisted clients by connecting them to mental health and substance-abuse support. David has contributed to the United Way campaign and volunteered with other Rochester charities. As he was eager to continue his experience with data, David joined three+one as a Client Services Associate and will be assisting the team with data collection.

David recently moved from his hometown Geneva, NY, to Penfield, NY. He has a passion for sports, especially football. Not surprisingly, his favorite pro team is the Buffalo Bills. In his free time, Dave enjoys walking with his fiancee and their dogs, playing competitive yard games, and spending time with his family and friends.

Garrett Macdonald is the Executive Vice President at three+one, a national financial-technology company that assists public entities and higher-education institutions execute borrowing, investing, and cash-management decisions. Since joining three+one in 2015, Garrett has played an integral role in developing the firm’s suite of tools including cashVest, rfpPrep, and muniBank. He has also helped lead the expansion of its business across the United States. Garrett leads three+one’s client-acquisition and client-servicing teams and is on its senior-management team.

He has worked with some of the nation’s largest public entities and higher-education institutions and their governing boards, investment committees, and financial institutions. For them, he has developed numerous treasury-services efficiencies, leading to improved cash-management strategies, enhanced banking arrangements, and simplified treasury-management processes. These advancements have generated measurable and sustained public value for these entities.

Before joining three+one, Garrett served as an Efficiency Resource Consultant for a global non-profit. He traveled widely for this organization, both nationally and abroad, including such far-flung places as Singapore, Indonesia, and the United Kingdom.

Garrett attended St. John Fisher University in Rochester, NY, where he graduated magna cum laude with a B.S. in Corporate Finance. He went on to earn his MBA there with high distinction. Also, while at St. John Fisher, he received recognition for his scholastic accomplishments and community service. Garrett was invited to join Beta Gamma Sigma, the highest honor a business scholar can receive from an AACSB-accredited business school.

He was a research contributor and co-author of Elementary Financial Derivatives, a 2016 textbook on derivatives and securities, with Dr. Jana Sacks. He also co-authored an academic publication on corporate sustainability and its impact on shareholder returns.

Through the Association of Finance Professionals, Garrett earned his Certified Treasury Professional® (CTP) designation and is also a Certified Corporate Financial Planning & Analysis Professional® (FPAC). He earned a certificate in “Artificial Intelligence: Implications for Business Strategy” from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Garrett received a master’s certificate in High-Performance Leadership from the National Association of Counties (NACo) High-Performance Leadership Academy.

Garrett is a frequent speaker and panelist for regional and national conferences, including those sponsored by NACo, the Government Finance Officers Association (GFOA), the Alaska Municipal League (AML), the New York Association of Counties’ Finance School, the Texas Investment Academy, and the Pacific Consortium of College and Universities (PACCON). Garrett sits on the banking and investment management committee for the New York GFOA. He is on the Board of Directors and the Finance Committee for the Baden Street Settlement, an organization addressing poverty and quality of life for neighborhood children, youth, adults, and seniors in Rochester, NY. Garrett is also on St. John Fisher University’s Alumni Board of Directors.

Samantha Rothschild is an accomplished Sales and Marketing professional with over 20 years of experience in the advertising industry. Samantha joined three+one in 2021 to focus on marketing strategy, campaign execution, and partner development.

Before joining three+one, Samantha acquired experience in the out-of-home, digital, and television advertising space. Her experience comes from having been on both sides of the table- as a media seller and at the agency level, bringing unique qualifications to the three+one team.

A proud graduate of St. John Fisher University, Samantha received a B.S. degree in Sport Management and minored in pre-law before finding her passion for marketing strategy. Samantha has a strong appetite for knowledge and is a constant student, interested in learning anything and everything people are willing to teach her. In her spare time, Samantha enjoys spending time with friends and family, practicing yoga, and working on personal development.

Abby is a native of Brighton, a suburb of Rochester, NY. She graduated from SUNY Geneseo in 2016 with a Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, and a minor in Sociology. During her time there, she presided over several clubs, including the Marketing Club, the Accounting Society, and Phi Beta Lambda.

Upon graduation, she first worked in local government, joining the Monroe County Parks Department. It was during her time with this department that Abby felt called to continue her education. To that end, she moved to California to pursue her MBA. Upon completing this advanced degree at the University of Redlands she realized that her heart was at home, and came back to the Rochester area.

Upon her return, she joined The Bonadio Group, a major New York State CPA firm. There Abby worked in the Government, Compliance, and Labor Department, where she specialized in Taft-Hartley Plans and Employee Benefit Plans.

After five years of acquiring knowledge in this sector with The Bonadio Group, Abby followed her passion for public service to join the team at three+one as a Financial Analyst.

When she’s not working, Abby enjoys spending time with her family—and their many dogs—at the Thousand Islands cottage that’s been in the family for decades. For recreation, she is a member of a kickball team, a cornhole league, and loves honing her skills in the game of darts.

Joseph Rulison’s multi-faceted career in the financial services sector gives him an expansive viewpoint and breadth of knowledge matched by very few. Since his graduation from St. John Fisher University in 1978, Joe’s professional journey has taken him from being an account executive at Prudential-Bache Securities to his current position as CEO and Co-Founder of three+one, a liquidity analytics and data provider to public entities, higher Ed, and banking institutions throughout the United States.

As President and CEO of Rulison & Company, Joe created a product called Muniflow that helped governmental entities invest their funds without jeopardizing their cash liquidity needs. In 2001, Joe sold Muniflow to Bank of America and served there as Market President in the Rochester, NY region while rolling out his product line throughout the bank’s national footprint.

From 2009 until the launch of three+one® in 2014, Joe managed the J. P. Morgan’s Private Bank in Upstate New York. In this capacity, he managed the Upstate New York team covering Trusts, Estate, Investment Management, and Custody of assets for high net-worth individuals and non-profit organizations.

Joe’s commitment to the community is vast. He is currently a Board Member and Treasurer of the Monroe County Water Authority, Board Member to VisitRochester, and Trustee to the University of Redlands in Redlands, CA. In addition, Joe has served as Chairman of the Board to St. John Fisher College, former Chairman of the County of Monroe Industrial Development Agency (COMIDA), as Chairman of the Board of Trustees for Geva Theatre and a member of the Town of Brighton, NY Town Board. In 2006, Joe received an Honorary Doctor of Laws degree from St. John Fisher College for his work on behalf of the College and the Rochester Community. In 2017, Joe was recipient of the Distinguish Alumni Award from his high school, Christian Brothers Academy, for his commitment to helping others achieve their goal.

Cooper Swartwout joins three+one as a business development officer where he will build relationships with public sector and higher Ed partners in pursuit of maximizing their financial wellbeing.

Prior to joining three+one, Cooper started his career in public accounting with Deloitte & Touche. At Deloitte, Cooper served as an Audit Associate and served primarily on renewable energy companies specializing in inventory oversight and testing. Although his time at Deloitte was brief Cooper gained valuable experience and an understanding of the importance of proper record keeping and data analytics.

Cooper graduated from St John Fisher University in 2022, with a B.S. in Accounting and Finance. While at Fisher Cooper served as the President of the Dean Student Advisory Council and of the student lead Investment Club. Cooper also participated on the men’s tennis and golf team, and has since given up the tennis racquet for a pickleball paddle.

Cooper is excited to be joining the team at three+one where he will be in a much more client facing role. His goal is to create lasting business relationships with new public entities and higher education institutions, ultimately increasing revenue for both them and three+one.

Kevin Teborek recently relocated to the Rochester area from Chicago, after selling his business there. He brings a diverse background to three+one, after having spent time as an entrepreneur as well as many years working in the financial sector. His unique background and experience are sure to bring a breadth of knowledge and depth to the three+one team.

Kevin earned his B.A. degree from Hobart and William Smith College and an MBA from the University of Rochester’s William E. Simon School.

On the personal side, he most enjoys spending time with his wife, Carrie, and their two children and sailing on Lake Ontario. An avid sailor since his teens, Kevin helps up-and-coming younger sailors through the Sodus Bay Junior Sailing Association; he currently serves on its board of directors.

Edna brings a diverse background in the financial industry to three+one®, including positions in both the private and public sectors. Edna began her career by honorably serving in the United States Marine Corps for four years.

For another eight years, she worked as a legal and administrative assistant for the U.S. Treasury Department in New Jersey. She then moved into the private sector, advancing from Compliance Analyst to Senior Administrator in Internal Compliance for Schwab Capital Markets. From there, she continued her work as a Compliance Specialist for JP Morgan Chase. Outside of her work in the financial industry, Edna is a health and wellness coach and a martial arts trainer.

Mariam Turmanidze, originally from the small town of Batumi in the Republic of Georgia, is a finance professional with a passion for data-driven insights and strategic decision-making. She holds a Master of Science in Finance from the Simon Business School at the University of Rochester. Prior to earning her master’s degree, Mariam completed a Bachelor of Science in Finance with a Minor in Computer Science at the same institution, where she excelled academically and was recognized for her leadership and scholastic achievements.

During her time at Simon, Mariam’s academic excellence earned her recognition in the Beta Gamma Sigma Honor Society, representing the top 10% of her class. Her practical experience includes roles such as an equity research analyst with the Simon Meliora Fund, where she conducted in-depth analysis contributing to investment decisions for a hedge fund, and as a consultant at Simon Vision Consulting, where she optimized supply-chain operations for a fast-food chain.

In her free time, Mariam loves working out to keep fit and healthy, as well as indulging her passion for travel by exploring different cultures and cuisines from around the world.

With significant financial, analytical, and technology experience in both the public- and private-sector marketplace, Jessica brings a deep understanding of the way a public finance office operates, along with advocating for local issues and needs. This is coupled with well-honed analytical skills having worked at a private, global technology leader.

Following the completion of a B.A. in Finance and an M.B.A. in Economics at Virginia Tech, Jessica began her career in the public sector as a financial analyst for the City of Norfolk, VA. This led to her role as City Economist for the City of Richmond, VA. There she focused on financial forecasting, budget writing, and policy analysis, helping local governments manage through the great recession.

In 2011, Jessica relocated to Seattle, joining the non-partisan staff at the Washington State legislature. While there, she developed the state’s education and transportation budgets, totaling $22 billion and $4 billion, respectively. After completing her work on the development and negotiation of a $7.2 billion education-funding-reform package—resolving a seven-year-long court case—she transitioned to the private sector, joining Amazon in 2018.

At Amazon, Jessica was able to direct team efforts toward financial reporting, process improvement, automation, and financial controllership. Partnering with business and financial leadership and their business-intelligence team, she improved internal reporting to ensure leaders were all working from a “single source of truth.” She was able to reduce reporting run times, created automated reports that could be responsive to dynamic queries, and created a new reporting process for key performance indicators that was adopted throughout the corporation.

Jessica made her way back to her hometown, Rochester, in 2020 and became a member of the three+one team.

On the personal side, she has a passion for traveling, reading, and cooking. In her free time, Jessica enjoys spending time with her family and her dog, Natty. Training her young horse, Marlow, also keeps her busy. An avid hiker, she’s also recently started working on becoming a 46er, climbing all 46 of New York’s highest peaks. Her charitable work includes volunteering with the Raise a Glass Foundation, and working with local high school and college equestrian teams.

A mathematician by education and training, Jacob joins the three+one team as a financial analyst. With experience in both higher education through his intensive research, and a post-academic career in the private sector as an accountant, he is well-positioned to understand and provide critical insights to the financial health and liquidity management of three+one partners.

Jacob attended Rochester Institute of Technology having earned both a bachelor and masters of science degree in applied and computational mathematics. While at RIT, he was a leading contributor to team-development of a model used to perform predictive analysis within networks to reduce costs and limit inefficiencies. Continuation of this work is pivotal to the financial well-being of three+one’s clients and their stakeholders.

LaTonya will be supporting her team members by assisting with data collection and implementation. LaTonya currently resides in Rochester, NY, with her husband, Roger, and two daughters. She is a proud alumnus of Livingstone College (Salisbury, NC), where she earned her Bachelor of Science degree in Political Science.

LaTonya joined three+one with over 25 years of banking experience with JPMorgan Chase. While employed at JPMorgan Chase, she served in various roles, such as Team Leader (Personal Credit Services), Supervisor (Correspondent Mortgage), and Client Service Associate (Middle Market area covering municipal and government clients). LaTonya currently works closely with entities to gather and analyze banking data to ingest into our cashVest and rfpPrep platforms. She also frequently issues and manages rate quotes requests on behalf of public sector and higher Ed clients to ensure more equitable banking structures. Among clients of a similar size to Delaware County, LaTonya currently works closely with Harris County, TX; Suffolk County, NY; Orange County, NY; and the City of Columbia, SC, with interest breakdowns and balance check-ins. This is done to help manage balances and interest total amount earned.
